captions.text:
Welcome to the Olaf sneak peak Champion Spotlight
presented by Riot Games

Olaf is a unique melee DPS champion who scales
up in damage by building more hit points as
well as conventional damage items.

So you'll see a lot of radically different
builds on him.

First comes Undertow, where Olaf throws one
of his axes, damaging and slowing every enemy
it passes through.

The axe becomes embedded in the ground, allowing
him to pick it up and refresh most of the cooldown.

Second is Vicious Strikes which Olaf activates
for life steal, spell vamp and bonus damage
based on his maximum health.

Reckless Swing is Olaf's third ability, dealing
a set amount of damage which completely bypasses

armor and magic resistance, but hurts him
as well.

His ultimate is Ragnarok, significantly reducing
the amount of damage he takes, preventing

all stuns, slow and knock-up effects and giving
Olaf a bunch of armor penetration.

Lastly his passive is Berserker Rage giving
Olaf bonus attack speed as he gets lower  in life.

I use standard melee DPS runes, armor penetration
marks, dodge seals, flat magic resist glyphs
and flat health quintessences.

I recommend these for any melee DPS champion
you play, with very few exceptions.
My masteries are a bit different.

I go 12/17/1, taking improved Cleanse, improved
Ghost, the health bonus in defense and the
armor penetration bonus in offense.

Olaf has the potential to pick up champion
kills very early in the game.

Mundo is clearly overextended here and by
using Undertow, picking up the axe and throwing

it again and again, Olaf has great chasing
potential.

However, in most cases, Olaf is not an early
game champion killer.

The slow on Undertow is very low for its cooldown
and because he's so powerful later on, your
best bet is to focus on minion kills.

With good timing, his 57 base damage should
be enough to get at least half the minions

in the lane, combined with a friendly Janna
for even better results.
Let's talk about aggression.

You always want to kill off the easiest champions
first for gold and experience but killing

a 0-3 Dr. Mundo and dying for it is significantly
worse than just farming minions, especially

since I just donated 476 gold to Malphite
for my killing spree.

You should always err on the side of caution
when turrets are involved.
I head to top to farm minions.

Most carries should try to farm non-stop for
the first 15 to 20 minutes, because you typically
never get a chance again.

Note my item choices, Phage and eventually
Frozen Mallet is by far the best item you
can get on Olaf.

I've also grabbed a Vampiric Scepter but in hindsight,
I think rushing Mercury Treads after Phage
is more important.
Let's discuss target selection.

Notice the previously fed Malphite has 142
armor.
There's really no way I can kill him, but I stick around anyway with Undertow and Vicious Strikes.
Don't make this mistake yourself.

I even use Ghost to try to chase him which
costs me a kill later on.

As soon as you have enough money, you must
buy Frozen Mallet.

As I catch up with my team in mid, notice
that I purposefully ignore Gragas until he's
left the protection of the turret.

I max Vicious Strikes first and Reckless Swing
second so I hit Gragas extremely hard while
Blitzcrank and Morgana keep him in place.

As the clip plays out you see that I have
to give up kills on Ezreal and Dr. Mundo.

Note that I would have been able to kill either
if I hadn't wasted Ghost during my chase on
Malphite earlier.
Your summoner spells are very precious.
Sometimes you just have to hit the tank.

Thankfully you have Reckless Swing at your
disposal.

While your critical strikes may only be
95 against targets with over 200 armor, the

pure damage of Reckless Swing means that Malphite
gets chopped up when it's time for him to die.

The third super important item after Frozen
Mallet and Mercury Treads is Stark's Fervor.

Flat armor reduction is great on Olaf because
it mixes in perfectly with his runes, masteries

and ultimate, making you the best at killing
low armor targets.

Even against 3 beefy tanks, Vicious Strikes
and Ragnarok allow me to cut up Mundo and
Gragas into little pieces.
Olaf is most dangerous while low on life.

Morgana and I fight Mundo and Anivia, killing
Dr. Mundo. As Morgana dies, I'm fighting Anivia
with under 100 health while inside her ultimate.

Thanks to Stark's Fervor, Vicious Strikes and
my passive, I can even tank the nexus turret
while just hitting minions.

Finally I get Elixir of Fortitude and Agility,
as well as Youmuu's Ghostblade.

Olaf's ability to chase and stick to single
targets with Frozen Mallet, Ragnarok and Ghostblade's
active is ridiculous.

Gragas tries to get away but I catch up with
Undertow.

He keeps running for the summoner platform,
but I pick him off with the axe throw.

Thanks for tuning in to the Olaf Champion
Spotlight.

Grab your axe, grab your helmet and hear the
call to action
